column4: quick question, wonder if anyone knows it.. if i only get a essid for wireless in uni, i should enter that into /etc/networks/interfaces right? can't seem to get wireless working
what kind of encryption is that wifi network running?  you using dapper?  gnome?  kde?
not quite sure what kind of encryption, they didn't say
know if the network you're trying to connect to uses wep or wpa encryption?
they wanted us to install vpn as well, if that helps
did "they" give you a password to join the wifi network?  any instructions at all?
no.. no passwords. they gave instructions for windows, =\
i'm not familiar with all of the various window managers.  can you run gnome applets w/ fluxbox?
the only reason that i ask is because configuring wireless is MUCH easier using the networkmanager applet for gnome, or knetworkmanager on kde.
so i've heard. i'll look into it, thanks.
i shall bring the problem to the techguys in uni :D
